fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Trade, Customs, Energy, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Food Safety, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
- European regulation on fertilisers (EC/2003/2003 and its evolutions) 
- European regulation on Classification Labelling and - Packaging of substances and mixtures (raw materials, micronutrients including borates) 
- Development of standards for fertilisers 
- European regulation on explosive precursors
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: EFBA is member of the International Fertilisers Society (IFS)
goals__remit:
EFBA  is an association of European Union member states involved in the production of compound fertilisers blended by using various nutrients in a number of regional factories. 
EFBA aims at :  
- Representing the common interests of fertiliser blenders at government level, such as the European Union in Brussels  
- Exchanging knowledge and information on fertilisers  
- Performing common actions to improve the quality of blended fertilisers and developp competitive and sustainable agriculture  
- Carrying out studies in order to optimise economical and technical handling
relevant_communication:
EFBA published a handbook on fertiliser blends available in three languages (english, french and german). 
EFBA has drawn up standards for desirable granule sizes for quality blends.
